poem:
Title: To Trevor Griffiths, A Dramatist in Dust.

In repose lies the mighty playwright, born of cogs and coal,
An ink-dipped scholar in the theatre of proletarian role.
Marx and Gramsci whispered in his scribe's immortal soul,
Fragmented factions dancing in his dramatic scroll. 
Men of Manchester remember, through dramatic highs and lows,
The fearless fire that fuelled Griffiths' poetic prose.
